page.title: 16Sir Sacheverell Sitwell
page.content: {SIR SACHEVERELL SITWELL:}Known in Weston as Sachi, is the youngest of the talented family of Sir George Sitwell. A result of the family love of art & literature the trio were a formidible force in artiistic circles from 1915-1950. Osbert & Edith were both known for their modernity & eccentricity in poetry & prose & worked with Sir William Walton on the ballets Facade & Belshazzar's Feast. Sachi's work was more studious but much ahead of his time; closely allied to music & art he remains a leading authority on Mozart & Liszt. With the years his work showed an increasing tendency towards the macabre. Now 88 years, he resides at Weston Hall & has become somewhat of a recluse through ill-health & inclination. His younger son, Francis & family joined him at the Hall.
